children.name: to take air, smoke etc into your lungs
breathe in b1
children.definition: breathe in  to take air, smoke etc into your lungs, through your nose or mouth:hít vào
examples: every time i breathe in i get a pain in the left side of my chest.
breathe in sth
i put my handkerchief over my nose to avoid breathing in the smoke.
they stood on the cliff breathing in the fresh sea air.

children.name: take a breath b2
children.definition: take a breath to breathe in once:hít một hơi
examples: sherman stopped, took a breath, and opened the door.
it was so quiet that i was afraid to take a breath.
take a breath of
every time you took a breath of that foul air you could feel it burning your lungs.
take a deep breathtake a lot of air into your lungs :
taking a deep breath she dived into the cool water

children.name: inhale x
children.definition: inhale to take air, smoke, or gas into your lungs, through your nose or mouth - used especially intechnicalandmedicalcontexts:hít vào
examples: it is dangerous to inhale the fumes produced by these chemicals.
every time he inhaled, his lungs made an awful wheezing sound.
inhale deeplyinhale a lot of air or smoke :
stella lit up a cigarette and inhaled deeply.

children.name: can’t breathe b1
children.definition: can’t breathekhông thở được
examples: do something -- he’s choking!
at last i reached the shore and fell onto the sand, choking and spluttering.

children.name: choke x
children.definition: choke to be unable to breathe because your throat is blocked or because there is not enough air:nghẹt thở (do bị chặn đường hô hấp) ngạt thở (do thiếu không khí)
examples: do something -- he’s choking!
at last i reached the shore and fell onto the sand, choking and spluttering.
choke on:ngộp thở
the old king died after choking on a chicken bone.

children.name: suffocate x
children.definition: suffocate to die because you are unable to breathe because youcannot get any air:chếtngạt
examples: many of the birds had suffocated in their boxes.
it was very hot inside the car, and i felt as though i was suffocating.
suffocation[u noun] when sb dies by suffocating :chết ngạt
glue-sniffing carries the risk of suffocation.

children.name: to take air into your lungs and send it out again
breathe b1
children.definition: breathe to take air into your lungs and send it out again through your nose or mouth :thở / hít thở
examples: the air was so smoky it was difficult to breathe.
the boy was unconscious, but he was still breathing.
breathe air/ fumes
people nowadays are becoming more and more concerned about the quality of the air they breathe.
breathe deeplytake a lot of air into your lungs as you breathethở sâu
i want you to breathe deeply and relax.

children.name: respire x
children.definition: respire  to breathe: thở, hô hấp
examples: he lay back, respiring deeply

children.name: to make sb unable to breathe
suffocate x
children.definition: suffocate to kill sb by preventing them from getting any air:làm chết ngạt
examples: they pushed a plastic bag over his head and almost suffocated him.
they found her half-suffocated from the poisonous gases given off by the burning furniture.

children.name: choke x
children.definition: choke if a person or smoke, gas etc chokes sb, they make it very difficult or impossible for them to breathe:làm nghẹt thở
examples: don’t hold so tight, you’re choking me.
i felt myself being choked by thick, yellow fumes.
choke sb to death
he grabbed her around the neck and choked her to death.

children.name: sniff c2
children.definition: sniff to breathe in noisily through your nose, for example because you have a cold or because you are crying:khụt khịt, sụt sịt
examples: stop sniffing! use your handkerchief.
‘i’m sorry i got so upset,’ she sniffed.
the dog raised its nose in the air, sniffed, and then started to follow the scent.
sniff[c noun]tiếng khụt khịt, sụt sịt
his mother gave a sniff and asked if he had been smoking in his bedroom.

children.name: sigh b2
children.definition: sigh to breathe in and out noisily, because you aredisappointed,tired, orsad, or because you can begin torelaxafter worrying about sth:thở dài
examples: frank sighed deeply and stared out of the window.
‘that’s life, i suppose,’ she sighed.
sighing wearily, she began her routine of getting ready for bed.
sigh[c noun] [b2] tiếng thở dài
with a sigh
‘oh no!’ he said with a sigh, ‘not again!’
breathe/ give a sigh of reliefbecause you are no longer worried about sth thở dài nhẹ nhõm
irene closed the door behind her and breathed a big sigh of relief.

children.name: snore b2
children.definition: snore to breathe noisily while you areasleep:ngáy
examples: my husband snores so loudly that i find it difficult to get to sleep.
if you snore, it’s better not to sleep on your back.
snoring[u noun]
isn’t there something you can do about your snoring?

children.name: gasp c2
children.definition: gasp tosuddenlybreathe in noisily, because you aresurprised,shocked, or inpain:
examples: thở hổn hển
i gasped when i heard how much the ring had cost.
the crowd gasped as the plane burst into flames.
gasp with amazement/shock/pain etc
one of the boys hit him in the face, and he gasped with pain.
gasp[c noun] [c2] the sound you make when you gasp:tiếng thở gấp
gasp of astonishment/pain/disbelief etc
there were gasps of astonishment from the audience

children.name: snort x
children.definition: snort tobreatheoutvery noisily through your nose, especially to show that you areamusedorannoyed:khịt mũi, thở phì (thở ra chứ ko phải hít vào)
examples: my sister snorts when she laughs.
the horse lowered its head, and snorted at them.
snort[c noun]tiếngkhịt mũi, thở phì
from the other side of the library came a loud unmistakable snort -- it was the professor.

children.name: to send air, smoke etc out of your lungs
blow b1
children.definition: blow to breathe out strongly, especially while making a circle with your lips: thổi
examples: i put the balloon to my lips and blew as hard as i could.
he blew smoke rings across the table.
blow on/into etc
‘this coffee’s too hot to drink.’ ‘blow on it -- that’ll cool it down.’

children.name: breathe out b1
children.definition: breathe out to send air out of your lungs, through your nose or mouth:thở ra
examples: the doctor told her to breathe out slowly.
ballet dancers are taught to breathe in before they leap, and to breathe out after they land.

children.name: exhale x
children.definition: exhale to send air or smoke out of your lungs through your nose or mouth - used especially in medical or technical contexts:thở ra
examples: hold your breath for 5 seconds, then exhale slowly.
she took a long pull on her cigarette, exhaled and coughed loudly.
take a deep breath in then exhale into the mouthpiece.

children.name: breathing x
children.definition: breathing the process of breathing air in and out: thở, hô hấp
examples: the disease in his lungs made breathing very painful.
breathing became more difficult as we got higher up the mountain.
deep breathingbreathing a lot of air into your lungs:việchít thật sâu
deep breathing is good for relaxing your mind and your body.
heavy breathingloud breathing:thở nặng nhọc, thở mạnh
when i picked up the phone all i heard was heavy breathing.
shallow breathingbreathing in which you only take a small amount of air into your lungs with each breath

children.name: breath b1
children.definition: breath the air that you breathe in or out:hơi thở
examples: it was so cold they could see their breath.
i could feel the horse’s breath on the back of my neck.
bad breathbreath that smells unpleasant:hơi thở có mùi
his teeth were rotten and he had bad breath.
hold your breathstop yourself from breathing for a short time.giữ hơi, nín thở
how long can you hold your breath underwater?
get your breath back/ catch your breath[vp]lấy lại hơi
it took me a few minutes to get my breath back after climbing the stairs.
once you’ve got your breath back we can do a few more lengths of the pool.

children.name: respiration x
children.definition: respirationnoun  breathing: hít thở, hô hấp
examples: her respiration was slow and difficult.
the diaphragm is the principal muscle of respiration.
respiratory[attri adj] [formal or specialized] relating to breathing: hô hấp
smoking can cause respiratorydiseases.

children.name: breathless x
children.definition: breathless/ out of breath having difficulty breathing, especially because you have just beenrunning,climbingstairs etc :hết hơi, hổn hển
examples: she sounded a little breathless, as if she had been running.
we were all a little out of breath when we got on the train.
can we have a rest? -- i’m a bit out of breath.
breathlessness[u noun]sựhết hơi, hụt hơi
the poor lady, judging by her breathlessness and flushed cheeks, was exhausted..

children.name: pant x
children.definition: pant to breathequicklyandnoisilywith your mouthopen, for example, because you have just been running :thở hổn hển (há hốc cả miệng)
examples: matt was still panting after his run.
when i reached the top of the stairs i was puffing and panting like an old steam engine.
a strange brown dog suddenly jumped all over him, panting, its tongue out.

children.name: gasp c2
children.definition: gasp to breathe very quickly and deeply because you are having difficulty breathing normally, for example after running fast or because you have been injured:thở hổn hển
examples: the hill was very steep and they were all gasping by the time they got to the top.
‘do you think you can walk?’ i asked. ‘i’ll try,’ he gasped.
gasp for breathbecause you can hardly breathe
his mother was coughing and gasping for breath.

children.name: short of breath x
children.definition: short of breath unable to breathe easily, especially because you areunhealthy: khó thở
examples: when i wake up in the morning i’m often very short of breath.
she got short of breath very easily because she was so overweight.
the fog irritated his lungs and made him short of breath.

children.name: puff x
children.definition: puff to breathe loudly and with difficulty, because you are doing sth which needs a lot ofphysicaleffort:thở nặng nhọc, thở phù phù (vì làm gì mất nhiều sức lực)
examples: you could see her puffing as she carried the heavy washing basket.
‘sorry i’m so late maxie,’ he said, puffing breathlessly.xin lỗi tôi đến trễ
huff and puffto breathe loudly, usually after physical exercise
we were huffing and puffing by the time we'd climbed to the top of the hill.

children.name: be stuffed up x
children.definition: be stuffed up/be bunged up spokento have difficulty breathing through your nose because youhave a cold:bị ngạt mũi (bị cảm)
examples: she doesn’t want to go to school. she says her throat is sore and she’s stuffed up.
be all bunged up
i couldn’t sleep last night because i was all bunged up.

children.name: wheeze x
children.definition: wheeze to breathe with awhistlingnoise in your throat and chest because you areillorunhealthy:thở khò khè ( vì bị bệnh )
examples: when she coughed she made a terrible wheezing sound.
his asthma was acting up and he wheezed throughout the show.
